text: Pours hazy honey, barely any head. Aroma offers sharply tart pomme fruit. Flavor features tart fruit and a hint of woody hops. Mouthfeel presents decent body, OK fizz and a tart finish. Oude to joy.

Draft at Verzekering. Pours cloudy amber. Aroma is good funk, farmhouse, old cheese, stables, straw. Body is light, funky, lightly tart and sour, with some sweetness backing it up. Smooth experience, basically flat. Short funky palate. Good!
Cask pour. Hazed copper with no carb. Strong wood and lemon acidity. Some mellow fruit in the taste. Drying and a little earthy on the finish. Medium body and medium carbonation.
At the brewery as Assemblage, blend of three years if Im not mistaken. Pours dark golden, no head. Fruit, moderate+ sour, pronounced wood, funk, dry finish. Medium bodied.
Pour from bottle at Lambik-o-droom. Hazy amber with no head. Woody, grassy, grainy, hints of nutmeg. Mild sour and light bitter. Medium body and no carbonation. Woody grassy funky.
On tap. Fast klare orange goldene Farbe. Geruch angenehm säuerlich fruchtig, Steinobst, leicht holzig, Äpfel. Geschmack angenehm säuerlich, Steinobst, rote Früchte, holzig.

Vollmundiger säuerlicher Antrunk mit trockenem, mild herben Noten. Weich, angenehm bitter, spritzig. Trockene dumpfe Hopfigkeit, zum Ende deutlich holzig. Langer, weich säuerlicher Nachhall. 11/12/12/12//12Earlier Rating: 6/3/2011 Total Score: 2.3Hopfig-säuerlicher Antrunk, der mit seinen Beinoten aber angenehm ausfällt. Wenig frisch, fast laff. Im Verlauf wird die Säuerlichkeit fast unwichtig, der muffige Hopfen stärker. /8/6/6//7

Bottle from the source. Hazy golden amber color see pic please. Dusty musty horse blanket aroma. Taste is sour with stone fruit and decent funk. Delicious. Earlier Rating: 6/26/2010 Total Score: 4.2Draught at the tasting room, courtesy of Armand - thank you sir!  Brewed in January 2009, tasted in June 2010.  Classified as a jonge lambik by Armand, but meets Ratebeers definition and description of an oude lambik.  Slight haziness, variegated color from golden brown to yellow.  Small white head that disappears rapidly.  Aroma of slight dust and must,, lemon peel.  Taste is cour citrus, acidic and very dry, especially at the finish.  Wonderful!

Pours bit darker blonde/light amber. No head. Smell is full, funk, wood. Mild sour . taste is very full , dry, oaky. Very full wood ! Dry mouthfeel, nice as expected. Malty aftertaste Earlier Rating: 4/20/2015 Total Score: 4.1Pours unclear towarss amber. Smell is funky and wood. 
Taste is mild, with an intense sour background. Very woody. very nice

UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 Tap at Grote Dorst. Hazy dark golden color with no head. Aroma is burnt bread, wood, not so much funk. Taste is burnt bread, some milky yeasts. Oily mouthfeel. Flat. Okay, probably one of the last pours of the bag, but still: it showcases the 3 Fonteinen character. 7-3-7-3-14.

Assemblage at the Lambik-O-Droom. Hazy orange color with soapy bubbles. Aroma is funky. Taste is funky, with quite some residual sugars, apples and candy. Flat. Very interesting. 7-4-7-4-15
Heel donker geel bijna oranje. Een intemse geur van paardestal met een licht zurig tintje. De smaak is droog, haverig en deegachtig.

From notes. Enjoyed on draft at the Drie Fonteinen Restaurant on November 12. This one had an advertised age of 6 months. The pour is a dark orange, almost brown, with no head at all. This is syrupy and looks nothing like I was expecting for a lambic. The aroma is very sugary sweet. There is a strange bitter malt going on. There is a light Bandaid thing happening, but its just interestingly sweet. The flavor is definitely syrupy. This is sugar sweetness, a strong barrel, and just a strange flavor overall. The mouth feel is very heavy and syrupy. There is no carbonation and a lingering medicinal sweetness. I will never understand the lure of young, unblended lambics. Not my thing at all.

Draft at brewery. Decanted from a barrel pull by Armand. 18 months old. It pours a clean golden color with no head. Aroma is mildly funky, grassy, lemony with a light vanilla oaky note. Taste is also lightly spicy oaky, with mild vanilla sweetness, medium tart and lemon peel. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, good unblended lambicalcohol,

Draught at the brewery. Pours hazy amber with a small and quickly dissipating white bubbly head. Aroma is light cellar and oak notes, medium cracker malt, tart lemon. Flavor is moderate tartness, lemon notes, light cracker malt, cellar and oak notes with a dry finish. Light body and nearly still.

Headless, which is the style but it still looks off to me. Its beer. Sorry. Soft funky, some apple cider, amber malt like aromas even. Still woody, although not AS woody as expected. Very different sourness and taste profile than the bottles, quite flat (but bit watery), very woody taste, plucking in the end but oddly not really sour in the sharper, vinegar sense. Aroma is hard to grasp after some sips. A unique beer and I find it tasty too. Wouldnt drink it all the time. (On tap at the 3 Fonteinen restaurant)

28/XI/15 - cask @ Winters Bierfestival (Vichte) - BB: n/a (2015-1651) Thanks to Bierridder_S and the Gentse Biervereniging crew for sharing todays beers!
Clear orange to pale amber beer, no head. Aroma: very buttery, bit fruity, lots of diacetyl. MF: no carbon, medium body. Taste: buttery start, lemon juice, funky, bitter touch, bit woody. Aftertaste: dry tannins, sourish, butter, some apple juice, funky finish.

Sample at Winters bierfestival Vichte. Many thanks Melissa and Stijn!
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, almost no head.
NOSE: very sour, horseblanket, fruity.
TASTE: dry, bitter ending, sour.

(On cask @ 3 Fonteinen Restaurant, Beersel, Nov 14 2015) Pours lightly hazed medium gold with no head. Aroma is pretty soft, lemony hints, very light barnyard, not much really. The flavour is much more powerful with an initial soft acidic lemon zest character, slightly buttery or creamy oak, light pit fruit, smooth. Transitions to an oak dominated finish with hay, dried herbs, a bit of horse blanket, citrus zest. Astringent finish. Fairly light bodied, very light carbonation. 3F character for sure! The nose on this was a real letdown, but the flavour made up for it. Not wildly funky, good balance for an unblended lambic.

28/11/2015 15cl sample @WBF2015, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte, shared with tderoeck.
Amber coloured, no head. Wood, light sour, light fruity, some sherrynotes.
@ Winters Bierfestival, Vichte. Unclear amber colour, no foam. No carbonation. Sweet and buttery with tart citrussy notes. Barnyard and funk. Ok.
Draft at Winters bierfestival Vichte. Butter, diacetyl, sweet, not very pleasant to drink.

Tap at Drie Fonteinen restaurant, Beersel. Clear orange, no real head. Aroma is apple pie, rotting wood, some water. Body is medium, smooth, watery. Taste is apple, resin, glue, some oak. A touch watery in body and taste, but still a very interesting and tasty beer.

Tap at 3F restaurant, 20/11/15.
Clear golden with a limited white covering that quickly dissipates to nyadda. 
Nose is sweet and sour fruit, light wood, trace of caramel, straw, funk.
Taste comprises tarte lemon, dried fruits, prune jus, farmy, balsa wood, funk, bitter orange, grape must.
Medium bodied, flat with limited carbonation, drying close with a light puckering effect. 
Ok if a little washed out.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Sampled at the brewery, Murky orange golden color, notes of vanilla and butter oak, Chardonnay, lemon, and dusty wet woods. Finish is pleasant and long lasting. Fuller mouthfeel with light but prickly carbonation.

From hand pump at the brewery. Free sample from armand. Thanks! Poured a clear golden colour with no head. Nose is citrus, lots of dusty funk, barnyard, rotten green apples, oak, grains and lemon juice. Lovely sour aftertaste.
Tap at the brewery. Pours clear copper with a few bubbles. Aroma is meaty, light fishy, wood, citrus and some light funk. Flavour is moderate acidic. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Tap at the brewery, free sample, thanks! Clear golden with a few little bubbles on top. Light sour grains, flowers, bitter wood with a touch of vanilla, dry white wine, leafy raw vegetable nots and soft weeds. Taste is light to medium sour and light bitter. Under medium bodied with dry feel and low but sparkly carbonation. Light and fresh, surprisingly complex. I could drink this all day ( not good idea as it is now only 11). Maybe a tiny bit more bitter than Id like, but very nice stuff.

Cask at 3 Fonteinen. Almost clear golden liquid with minimal white head. Aroma of lemon, barnyard, grain, mineral and light apple skin. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of lemon, funk and light bread. Medium bodied with very low carbonation. Nice.

Keg at The 24th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. Cloudy Orange with an absence of head. Irn Bru look. Aroma of funky lemon and wood. Theres a wee touch of sweetness kicking about in there too. It works really well. Grapfruit sour with a nice farmyard funk. Really delicious.

Cask at restaurant today. After visiting many times and only having Jonge, this was a nice surprise. Hazy orange nose is light. Minor lemon and a lot of acidity. Its very sour. Lots of wood, a touch of sea salt. Really sticks to the teeth. Little bit of sweetness with a lot of lemon at the finish
From barrel @ the brewery served by Armand. 11 months old. Golden pour with no head. Lemon, funk and hay. Carbonation is flat.

On tap at 3Fs restaurant. Dark copper with no head. Aroma is barnyard, cheese and light hops. Taste has some acetic (less than the kriek), grain and lemon. Very low carbonation. Decent, but not in good shape.
big deep warm nose; overripe apple, fresh apple, orange juice and peel some oak aswell; well balanced

Fresh from brewery cask, served at the 3 Fontainen restuarant in Beersel. They didnt have a lambic on, so when i asked for it, the server vent and filled a jar for me at the brewey! Pours hazy golden with a a few white bubbes. Aroma is light sourness, dusty, sour green apples, wood, barnyard, hay, horseblanket, light sweaty. Flavor is nicely sour, grapes, green apples, wood, dusty, barnyard, light peppery notes. Thin to medium body, flat carbonation, lasting sour finish. Very refreshing and very easy to drink. 010814
pale yellow with slight orange glow...no head slight bubbles. Mead cider notes, verry dry, which I really like. Flavor is tart cider with apple and sour orange. Great Lambic

Ordered as Oude Lambiek (age?) Cask [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ restaurant, Beersel 27IV. Orange copper with astonishing 0,5 cm fresh head. Cultivated quencher, drying out a thirsty palate with rougher green apple cidre, mature vinegar, sulphur, leather on still quite a sweet body, with enough of those musty old hops that make you want to keep diving in. Both juicy and bone dry in the aftermath of the symphony. Actually prefer this to 3Fs acidic geuzes.

On tap at 3 Fonteinen. Orange yellow with no foam. Aroma and taste are sour, green apples like. Needs getting used to, tastes like the beer my grandmother served in her pub 50 years ago. (Beersel 201404)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at 3 Fonteinen Restaurant (Beersel). 1 year old as per the waiter. Slightly hazy golden with a medium quickly disappearing bubbly off-white head and no lacing. Theres the easily recognizable 3 Fonteinen funk in the nose along wooden notes, lemon and musty notes. Taste is also of 3F funk, sharp acidity, wood, cheesy notes and lemon. Light/medium body. Low/no carbonation. Finish is really dry. Very good lambic. Sharp and refreshing.

On cask at the restaurant. Hazy gold pour no head. Aroma is quite citric, very lemony, orange juice, light funk. Taste is very sour, lemon juice, sour wheat, fresh pie dough. Palate is bone dry, definitely fermented out. Very nice.
Very lemony lambic, a magnificent prelude of the great 3F gueuze. Sour as hell.

Drunk on draft at 3 Fonteinen in Beersel. Superb tart lambic.
 
 
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at 3 Fonteinen Restaurant, pours a clear golden copper with almost no head. Aroma dry tartness, a low funkiness and some woody oaky notes. Flavour is quite tart, bringing out notes of wood, oak, some medium funk, and some dusty woody notes. Nice and complex, with a wonderful balance of the different elements. Great stuff.

Sample @ 3F during TdG 13. Slightly hazy gold with no head. The nose is horse blanket, old barnyard, nose-tinkling lemon. The taste is light must and oak. Sharp lemon. Light and easy to drink. Very soft on the palate. Pretty good.

at TdG 2013 
Head: none 
Colour: blond/gold, slight hazy 
Smell: dry, old wet cloth, dusty, sour 
Taste: start is bitter and sour, next comes a dry more rounded flavour that leaves a nice flavour in the mouth, littly dusty but i dont mind that in a Lambik :-)

On draft at 3 Fonteinen last October. I cant believe I forgot to review this. Drank this while chatting away with Armand and his brother in the restaurant. What an experience. The beer is hazy orange to copper hued and appears still. Earthy, mushrooms, grass, farm, funk. Light and smooth. Refreshing and delicious. Complex yet simple. What a day. A memory I shall cherish forever.

Tap at 3 Fonteinen Cafe. It pours hazy amber, with a thick yellow-white head. The nose is vinegar, musty, damp wood, earth, light vomit, medicinal aspect and some underlying sweetness. The taste is sharp tartness, lemon, vinegar, moderate-high acidity, damp wood, earth and wet leaf, with a sour finish. Medium body and low/no carbonation. A solid earthy oude lambik, but I actually expected quite a bit more given my love of Armands blends!

A rather dark orange pour with no carbonation of head. Slightly sweet on the nose with a strong tropical fruit note. A lot of passion fruit notes, some citric tartness, and a little bit of lactic acidity. Some musty funkiness on the palate, tea, and light tartness. There is a very nice tropical fruit flavor, too, and some grapefruit and lemon tartness.
Fresh draft at the brewery.  Cask pour.  Earthy tart smell with a funky palate and quick clean finish.  Its light and clear and overall thin.  Tasty very simple lambic.

draft sample @ 3F restaurant // golden not much in the way of head // 3F funk, earth, touch soft old summer fruits. peach, sour lemons back, dust, weaker taste than the young one non-blended young one I had made by Boon in the same style as 3F used to, feels a bit diluted, feels like Boon? as far as characters go, maybe some Girardin? more than 3F to a certain extent // good but not as awesome as the young one or some of the other similar stuff

Aroma:humle eddike smør Ud.:røfgylden klar Skum:ingen  E.smag:sød lidt sur moderat Krop:let For.:vandede Brus:flad  
 28-5-11@ 20th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation

On draught at the 21st Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. Pours a dark golden colour with no head. Aroma is very grainy, reminiscent of a mash tun, with lemon and oak also. Similar flavours and mildly tart with a dry finish. Very low carbonation and an oily mouth-feel.

Golden colour, white head, even quite firm for a lambik. Aroma of citrus, quite tart, lambic, candy and quince. Tart, sour flavour, bone dry, very fresh. Bone dry, tart, medium long -or medium short- finish.
Very nice and lovely.
(Draught -beer engine with sparkler- @ ZBF 12)

plastic cask @ OHaras Freehouse. Rated on 10.07.2010
Aroma is sour with earthy notes. Flavour is also rather sour with earthy notes, some lactic acid and grapefruit. Nice and refreshing, probably the best unblended Ive had.

16/12/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (tap) 40 months old + 52 months old. Bevuta al Sour Winter Festival. Ambrata carica, lievemente torbida (più scura, quasi arancione, la 52 mesi), schiuma assente. Al naso sentori di mela (matura grattuggiata, dolcissima, nel caso della 52 mesi), note acidule, sfumature balsamiche. In bocca è acida, con note balsamiche, mielose, bilanciata in maniera magistrale (più la 42 mesi), molto persistente in bocca. Corpo medio, consistenza vinosa, carbonazione quasi assente (più pronunciata nella 52 mesi). Una esperienza unica. I voti: 4.5 per la 40 mesi, 4.2 per la 52 mesi. 4.3 la media.

Had this one several times, from the barrel, at the restaurant, at the Lambicodroom. At the restaurant there was too much Girardin wort in it, I guess the restaurant gets the less good lambic while the Lambicodroom has the better old lambic. This one still remains one of the better old lambics out there.
So a more fruity lambic (depend on which wort is used this time) and again the typical sourness citric taste in it.

Had on tap at the pub.  Pour is a dark golden amber color, mostly transparent with very little white head on the edges.  The nose is light cob web funk, sweet caramel transitions into sweet peach, orange and citrus, with a sour note accompanying.  The flavor has more dusty funk, creamy lacto aspects, very strong sweetness in back, tart sour lemon, citrusy orange, peaches, and light bitterness.  Creamy medium body with a soft palate and fairly assertive carbonation with a dry finish.  Great balance to this, very sweet and assertively sour, less funk than I thought going in but will add a nice dimension to a future gueuze.

Tap, Drie Fonteinen.  Pours a slightly hazy amber body with a small thinnish off-white head, similar to the Faro, but less frothy.  The nose is fairly light actually, smells of heavier malts and wheat with some cellar funkiness.  The flavor is fairly dry, quite funky and cheesy, not as much wood/barrrel character as I was expecting.  One year old, and shows minimal acetic/lacto character.  Mouthfeel is rather drying with the usual cask carbonation.  Not really as good as I was expecting, amazing that this is the stuff that Drie Fonteinen Gueuze comes from.

Poured from a plastic keg @ OHaras Freehouse, Tampere.
Originally rated on 20100710.
Amber colour. Apricot and rose hips on the nose and taste, some glue also on the taste. Quite refreshing though.

Cloudy orange/amber colored pour. No head and flat as can be. Need I say there was no lacing? Typical 3F funk and earthiness. Tart in the mouth with a nice leather and pepper flavor. Sour mouthfeel, tangy, viscous yet thin. Crisp, tart, refreshing way to wash away the warm day.

On cask at the Drie Fonteinen lambic room during last weeks Belgium trip. Reviewed from notes.

Served in a Drie Fonteinen stange.

Poured a fairly clear moderate orange color with a few bubbles but nothing much else.

Nose brought forward a good dosing of funk, light cheese, and a bit of citrus. Nice combination at this stage. Everything was beginning to meld. Good funk throughout. Light acidity in the flavor after some funk and must.

Light body with just a touch of carbonation and a light bit of acidity. Very tasty.

Aroma is deep sour brett, hay and barnyard.
Flavour is quite sour in a subtle way. Very smooth, highly drinkable.

Dark gold, light bubbled white head. Nose is rindy, grapefruit, cobweb, wood, very dank for a lambic and with little acid. Flavor is more citric fruits, low carbonation, dusty. Its already funky at 1+ yr, but its nicely balanced as well.
Pours yellow/gold with a white head.  Smells of dry, acidic funk, some tarte hints, peachy.  Tastes acidic and dry with some floral notes and a dank finish.
Centesima bevuta in grande stile! Un lambik grandioso, spesso sottovalutato! Grande Armand!

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Bottled oude lambiek brewed March 28, 2000.  Opened early 2011 from Tom Peters private stash.  One of six bottles that Armand bottled just for Tom and Monks.

A: Hazy light orange body. Completely still, no head, no lacing.

S: Massive earthy/woody aromas dominate.  Light sweaty component, some acidic lemon, and a subtle wet hay.

T: Like the nose, a very earthy/woody profile.  The 11 years in the bottle has really created a softened, delicate lambic.  A real treat to try a straight lambic with this much age.

M: Completely still.  Slightly acidic, no real sour puckering.  Medium bodied.

O: I have never had a lambic with this much age, and it was nice to explore what time in a bottle does to drie fonteinen lambic!

On tap at Chez Moeder Lambik. Dark golden in the glass, nice head. Modest sourish-fruity aroma. Starts a bit moldy-sourish, reminds me of ripe appels. Very light sweet hints in the background. Finish long lasting sour. Very good!

On tap at Copenhagen Oldage on 20 May 2006 as Drie Fonteinen Lambik.. No age stated so I assume this was the Oude Lambik. Overwhelmingly lemony in the flavour. Quite tart but didnt have that much depth. Like the Kriekenlambic, without any spritz to liven it up, I found the mouthfeel a touch dull. I prefer the geuze. Difficult to say when I might see this again but Ill give it another go, preferably on home turf.

(Draught at Moder Lambic Fontainas) The beer poured golden and a little bit hazy. Its head was small, sparse and white. Aroma had sourness, wood and vomit. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were sourness, wood, vomit, malts, a little bit of fruitiness and low bitterness. Aftertaste was sour and malty. This beer had all that is required for a gueuze but it was way too unbalanced.

Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. No head whatsoever, hazy copper burnt orange color.  Cheesy and lightly funky aroma.  Hints of cheese, sourdough, sour, lightly fruity but not overly fruity.  No carbonation really, medium MF.  Really nice, rounded, and very drinkable.  Good brew.
On tap at the brewpub.  Arrives flat and cloudy, almost muddy looking.  Wonderful sharp aromas.  Flavour is dry, tart, lemony.  Very nice!

UPDATED: APR 9, 2011 Sampled at the Drie Fonteinen Cafe, 2001
This was the second straight Lambic that I had ever had, it was again far mellower than I was expecting.  Of course it was sans-carbonation (say it with a Cajun man accent its much more fun that way) and had a quite noticeable acidic aroma.  The acidity promised in the nose was surprisingly subdued in the taste.  It was much more of a balanced / mellow acidity, which I am surmising, was the result of a bit of age that helps to smooth out Lambics.  The beer itself was quite a revelation.  There was a fair amount of musty character, and an appetizing hint of mushroom and a bit of character nabbed from a proper strong stinky farmhouse cheese.  All in all it was a great aperitif for the impending gastronomic exercise that I was about to have.

SÅDAN!
Meget smag af kirsebær . Lidt smag af fad/klæder. Grape, Dyb rød rigtig flot, uklar med rødt skum.
Dejlig sur uden at det bliver for meget, Let ,tør og livlig

On cask at 3 Fonteinen. Listed simply as Lambic- an unblended lambic. You need to work on figuring out the age if it is oude or jonge, this was the older version. Pours a cloudy orange color with no head at all, some bubbles. The aroma is sawdust, lemons and tartness. A very sour brew; woody, dusty, some sweetness struggles through but the tartness almost makes it stand out. Very raw and enjoyable.

Sampled cask conditioned at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours a slightly cloudy dark golden color. Nice aroma of acidity, fruits, cheese and funk. The flavor has a white wine quality to it, its also acidic, lactic and fruity. The body is light while the carbonation is very low. Great stuff.

Plastic [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
From the last batch of 3 Fonteinen. Hazy orange-amber color, no head. Slightly sour nose with fruityness: red currant, strawberries, tiny glue note. Flavor is similar: tart, fruits/berries (strawberries, black and red currant), some plastic/glueish notes. For glueish notes the reason is that this was served to plastic kegs 5 to 6 weeks ago.

Draught at the Lambikodroom and bottle courtesy of Armand. Brewed in February 2009 and tasted in June 2010. Golden color with a very small head that disappears. Aroma of must and dust. Taste has slight notes of dust and must, sour and dry citrus. Great lambic.

In short: A dusty lambik with a dry woody cider character.  Excellent
How: From the barrel at LambikOdroom (3 Fonteinen adjacent pub).  Graciously served free of charge by Armand himself.  
The look: Clear dark blonde body topped with almost no head
In long: According to Armand this is a 3 year old lambik, brewed march 2007.  Nose is dusty, musty, some apples.  Taste is some kind of dry cider, light funk, some leather, sour young red + green apples, wood.  Finish is quite woody dry.  A light astringent acidity but nothing like a Gueuze.  Typical oude lambic sparse carbonation.  During my second visit to Belgium I had many different draft Oude Lambics and this one was my favourite.  I still prefer assembled lambics but this beer almost made re-evaluate this statement.  Drinking this beer, served by the brewer, was a great moment but also a sad moment since I knew I was drinking from what might be the last barrel of lambic brewed by 3 Fonteinen.  And if that does not bring a tear to your eye I dont know what will.  You probably didnt cry when WALL-E got separated from EVE either.  You heartless man.

On draft at Moeder Lambic. Dark clear gold with virtually no carbonation. Aromas are of lemon tree (blossoms and fruit), wood, and mild funk. Quite funky upfront in the mouth, wet old wood mid sip, with a tart lemony finish.  Mouthfeel starts out slightly slick, but the finish is tart and acidic. Very refreshing. Went back for seconds of this one. It was great.

Had it draft. With a hazy gold color with a small white head.  Aroma of malts, apples and spices.  Flavors of sour apples, some straw and grass, light sugars and some spices.  No carbonation as it was flat. A little sweet and a light sour acid finish.  Very light and refreshing and plaisant.

On tap at lambikodrom. 16 months old, according to the brewer. Orange-copper colour with no head.  Aroma is very fruity and feels alive in some sens. Notes of gooseberries. Taste is quite acidic compared to other pure lambiks. Very fruity and with a special, almost vanilla-like smoothness. Really great.

on tap at the Backwoods Brewdown.  LIghtly hazy golden in color.  Aroma of sour apples, citrus zest, oak, and funk.  Taste: sour apples, mild citrus, a good amount of oak, and some funky barnyard. somewhat earthy.  Finishes sour with lingering lactic notes and lingering oak.
1 anno e 2 mesi oro schiuma assente gasatura praticamente inesistente note legnose leggero acido un tocco di ossidazione in bocca non molto acido una note dolciastra legno poi acidità più lattica
Caramelized straw colour.  Relatively phenolic aroma with limey fruit notes and fresh wood.  Tart and refreshing with a sugary kiss late.  Rustic, yet perfectly approachable.

Flat hazed amber color. Aroma of apples and some phenols. Juicy thick and nice palate. Really smooth and delicious flavors and belie the odd aromas. Again with the apples, which mellow into wood. Then tannins and tobacco leaves come out. A really neat experience.
Tap at beer tasting at valhal.Dark orange colour with no head.Aroma of apples and wood,low carbonation and dry sour finish.

tap valhal ølsmagning.
clear amber, no head.
aroma resembles apples and pears, and lots of sour. well balanced.
flavor is sour and acid, balanced. fruits. dry. nice and refreshing.
Tap. Clear amber orange colour, no head. Lovely tart fruity aroma. Very good mouthfeel. Sour and fruity bit woody flavour. Very long lasting sour fruity finish. Very nice unblended version.

From tap at Ølsmagningen i Valhal. Pours slight unclear golden orange with no head. Dry wooden and smooth acetone aroma. Dry and solid sour initial flavour, really giving a bite. Holds a mild fruity accent to a dry acetone note following this as the smoothness sets in. Lasting wooden/acetone and fruity finish.
Tasted at Brewery. Unclear amber with no head only small bubbles. Low carbonation. Lots of mouldy cellar notes. Manuer, wood & hints of caramel. Soft, dry and funky.

Following multiple samples over two years at 3 Fonteinen restaurant and most recently at Spinnekopke. Dark orange-copper color. Smells like a bunch of musty lemons crammed into some old gym socks. Somehow I’ve grown to love that, although I certainly didn’t the first time. Now the lemon comes out more in the aroma, adding refreshment while the funk adds character. Soft carbonation from acidity. Sour and lightly bitter. Bright, lively and intense.

Bottle 35 cl - stamped 17/02 2006.
This bottle was almost impossible to open - probably because of no carbonation.
Pours a hazy deep golden yellow that is quite similar (without other comparences) morning urine. No head.
The nose is fresh and clear with notes of green grapes, peach among other fruits. The palate is also fresh but a little waterish with an oily and sparkling finishing feeling. The flavour is sour, but mild and round and i taste peaches, pomelos, butter,and grains. Easy to dring

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2012 Cask gravity @ 17th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2008.Medium orange color with a virtually none appearance, virtually none lancing head. Aroma is midle, some apple and caramel notes, barnyard, Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and light moderate acidic with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat. (240508)  7-4-8-4-17 
Bottle 750ml. @ [ Sour&Bitter 2012 ] @ Refshalevej 163A, 1432 Copenhagen K, Denmark. [ As 3 Fonteinen 4 year Lambik ].Clear medium orange colour with a small, fizzy, virtually none lacing, fully diminishing head. Aroma is moderate to heavy horse blanket, barnyard, sour, wood. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate acidic with a long duration, apple - citrus, barnyard. Just lovely and well balanced. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. [20120510]   8-4-9-4-17

Aroma:  funky soft cheese, some pears, some minerals, earthiness, flowers, light fruit

Appearance:  golden yellow-broan

Flavor:  funky cheese with some fresh peach and apricot juices along with various other summer fruits-->yellow plums and some bosc pears--fruit pulpiness, light hoppiness and some yeast character

Palate:  smooth, very light but very filling--light cheese and fruit
Draught @ Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2008. Clear golden with no head. Mild sour aroma with barnyard and woody notes. Mild sour flavor with grapefruit and woody notes.

Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2008.  April 2007 brewdate.  Still and honey in color.  Initial nose of alcoholic chemical cleaner and apple juice, but turns to some light honey malt notes after a short time.  Vinuous and thin on the palate, flavors mostly of white wine, vinegar, chemical flavored malt, etc.  Low acidity, little yeast noticed, low tartness.  I expected it to be better but overall its still tasty.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 25/5/2008: RE-rating: Draught yesterday weekend spontaneous fermentation 08. 
Hazy golden color, with no head. 
Aroma complex, sourness, wood, fruits. Medium body.
Taste dry, sourness but soft,  malts.
Refreshing.
GOOD ONE !
Earlier Rating: 9/2/2007 Total Score: 4.5On tap @ Brussels 9th Belgian Beerwekend.
Cloudy orange color, with little white head. Aroma fruit a bit citrus. Medium body. Taste lovely sourness, some yeast, fruity, refreshing !
This is the real lambic !

On draught at the Drie Fonteinen restaurant, Beersel 24/5/08. Deep golden, hazy colour with next to no head. Aroma of citrus, a whiff of tropical fruit and some musty yeast.  Very tart flavour with plenty of the barnyard, a touch of woodiness and some more citrus fruit. A dry, slightly sour finish but refreshing.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2008 Bottle at BA Trollhättan
Thanks for satisfying my curiousity Jörgen. After a long night of English ale beer tastings I wanted something different to refresh my tastebuds. What could be more removed from a malty session ale than a Lambik I thought. I wasnt disappointed - this beer is shockingly different alright. Tastes of freshly squeezed lime and lemon juice and delivered with a puckering sourness that instantly dried the inside of my mouth, trapping me in a wonderfuly vicious circle of having to take another sip to quench the thirst this beer creates. So invigorating, so savagely sour and so memorable. For me the best beer in a great night of beers in Trollhättan.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015 Re-rate 9/20/15: Draught at 3 Fonteinen restaurant in Beersel. Great and refreshing. 8/3/8/4/17=4 
(3/10/08) On tap at Drie Fonteinen restaurant in Beersel. Slightly hazy golden with no head. Aroma of barnyard, a bit of citrus and some other fruits. A dry, sour flavor but not very sour, with some funk and some lemon. Medium-bodied. A great soft draught Lambic. 8/3/8/4/16=3.9

2008-03-07. "Van het vat" at the restaurant. Headless, still, dark amber body. Aroma is unexpectedly sweet, mild musty malts, sour touches emerge as it warms. (6+) First sip has a wave of sour escalating across the tongue. Further tasting has a moderate consistent sourness with a modest grainy wheat and malt in the flavour. Alcohol makes a brief jarring appearance after eating something between sips. As the glass warms a bit more lemon seed sourness starts to emerge. Average to light palate is typical of the style on tap, or at least the few that I have had. Pleasant, but I expected more somehow. On tap at 3 Fonteinen, Beersel

Tap at 3 Fonteinen.  Sour vinegar and musty barnyard aroma.  Yellow-brown color (like cider) with no head.  Smooth malt initially followed by a powerful tart/sour musty citrus flavor.  Very nice and made a very nice appertif for my meal.

on cask @ Brussels 9th Belgian Beer weekend. pours hazy golden with soapy white head. nose, not much here, oaky, musty, and slight vinegar. flavor is earthy, musty, apricot, and white grape. pretty interesting, not very tart or sour but smooth and easy to drink. dry finish, mouth feel is watery. really tasty stuff.
Hazy golden with a white head. A sour aroma of vinegar, horses and old apples. A nice sour flavor of granny smith apples, horses and stable. A dry and bitter finish.

Draft.  Cloudy orange/gold color with almost no carbonation.  First taste is sour, but it grows on your with some fruity notes.  I imagine this is what I would have been drinking 400 years ago (If I was lucky).

A Mes rate: 
Draught at 3 Fonteinen during the Toer de Geuze. A superb lambic. Cloudy orange colour. Lovely and sour with plenty of marmalade and other citrus stuff plus some yeasty fermentyness going on. Has the character of a geuze let alone a lambic. Excellent stuff.

Softer style that could have been served a bit colder. Slightly murky orange in colour. Sour fruits have  strange hard edge, almost like a steely riesling. Tart citrus fruits to finish. Low fizz gives a flabby feel. Unremarkable.

(e.1.50 200ml @ Brewery)

Partykeg at Copenhagen Beerfestival 2006Muddy light amber color. The aroma has some fruits (grapefruit) and cellar. Soft mouthfeel in the beginning (flat carbonation), high astringency, mixing fruitness and cellar touch.
Hazy orange with thin white head. Acidic aroma with berries, fruit and citrus. Flavour of fruit along with citrus and the inevitable sourness. Has a somewhat sharp taste.
Pours a light amber/orange color, slightly hazy with a thin white head. Very winey aroma and flavor, acidic, mild sour, apples, grapefruit/citrus, sweeter up front. Very good.
Draught at 3 Fonteinen. Hazy orange, no effervescence, some foam. Tart and oaky. Apples, slimy apples..

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2012 Hazy orange beer. Refreshing acid nose. Very refreshing acid, grapefruit, apple, flavour. 8-4-9-4-17
RBESG 2010, Lambik 2008, at Brasserie 4:20: Aroma has funk, spice, and grapefruit. Dry and tart, with funk and grapefruit flavour. Strong pepper note and some barnyard. 8-3-9-5-17
RBESG 2010, Lambik 2007: More pepper, less fruit. Same ratingSour & Bitter Festival CPH 2012. 4 Years Old. Lots of grapefruit and funk in the nose. Quite tart and lots of wood in the flavour. Completely still, which brings out a little less complexity and would result in a lower rating.

Draught - Bruxellensis Festival - A light amber coloured lambic.  The aroma is like a dry cider with some sweat and some brandy notes.  The taste is fairly dry.  Juicy and apply.  Clean, tasty and refined.  Certianly not overpowering.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2007 Rerated: 1 year old, on tap at the brewery. Yellowish brown with a small frothy head. Quite cloudy.Rich oaky vanilla aroma with a touch of lemons beneath. Complex oaky, lemony flavours with a certain caramel sweetness. Body is light and flat as appropriate. A world classic.
                                                             
On draught at Bruxellensis. 18 months old. Amber with almost no head, just a few bubbles alongside the glass. Vinous aroma, remniscent of port- rich, sweet and fruity. Plums and raisins. Complex flavours of raisins, sour fruit, dry wood and vanilla. No carbonation, medium body. A treat that is hard to come by. 8-3-8-4-17=4

Another gem. Lovely acidity, yet the mouthfeel is quite smooth, with no carbonation. Typical grapefruity/lemony acidity, grassy and a little bit woody aswell. So juicy and delicious, nice and smelly, we need more beers like this in this world.

Draught at Københavnske Øldage 2006.  Cloudy orange in colour with a very small quickly dissipating white head.  Dispite the small head this beer is beautiful to look at.  Stunning aroma of lemons, green grape skins, light wood, lots of citrus.  The flavour doesnt have the acidity of the aroma but still has large amounts of lemons, some oranges, light grapefruit and grass.  Very dry mouthfeel, light body, mild carbonation.  The finish seemed to last forever.  Intensely dry with a moderate sourness.  Mind-bogglingly good.

(on tap) Mark abricotgolor, no head. Very complex, fruity nose; ranges from green nuts(on trees) and pumkin to sour apples, raspberries and peas. Mouth in quite mild, dominating wheatmalts makes it foamy. Very long and clean finish, in the tones of grapefruitpeel and perfect rot.

On tap at Cph Beerfestival. Hazy orange beer with no carbonation and head. Yeast, green apples and lemon in the aroma. Quite citric and sour. It has a mellow, acidic flavor with lemon and apples, and some yeast/cellar. Thin, astringens body, and a dry finish. Nice and cleansing, and actually quite quaffable. (060519)

Draught at Københavnske Øldage 2006. Unclear muddy colour with no head. Nice light sourness aroma with notes of apple, orange, cherry nearly like juice. Very sour and acidity flavour little to sour for me. But ends up very refreshing.

Unclear golden body; Very big deep warm nose; overripe apple, fresh apple, orange juice and peel some oak aswell; Perfectly balanced, perfectly textured body, just great; Into a not overly sour finish lasting very long with overripe apple (warm tart tartin) and grapefruit. Super beer!

Draught at de Drie Fonteinen. Had this lambiek of around 6 months and 10 months. The 10 months old sample was already much better then the younger one. Aroma of cherry and wine vinegar. Cloudy, amber color, no head. Light sweet, light sour, hint of veggies, overripe apples. Soft and a bit dry.
Cloudy orange colour with a thin white head. Sweet and tart fruity aroma with notes of yeast. Sour apple fruity flavor with dusty notes.
UPDATED: JUL 2, 2012 Cloudy amber - no head. Plastic Jug. Grape/Citrus flavor. Good sourness. No carbon. Cloudy appearence. Nice and refreshing.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2006  orange colour (like "16 forskellige frugter")
lightly sour and no barbonation

Hazy amber golden, completely lacking head. Distinct, tart Brett aroma. Slightly watery body with a marked sourness. All the typical Brett characteristics: horse blanket, donkey manure - you name it. All fun stuff. 190506
Muddy orange colour with a small white head. Light acid, sour fruits, grassy aroma and taste. Medium body with a very dry finish.

Hazy golden coloured with a white head.
Aroma of apples, wood and fruits.
Light acidic flavour of apples, fruits and wood.
Pitcher at Københavnske Øldage 2006. Pours a clear yellow. Sour with aromas of resin and vinegar. No carbonation. Still learning to like this style.

Pours muddy orange with limited head. Aroma is complicated mixture of fruits, mostly dominated by grape and orange. This adds to the flavours as well, giving it a sour edge, mostly reminding of grape juice.

Draught. Pulpy dark orange coloured body with an initially medium creamy head that eventually turns to a persistent small covering.  Citric aroma - lemon, oranges, hay, grass, and mild wheat character. Punchy flavour with little carb - smooth and buttery fruit flavours - quite dry and puckering. Grapefruit pulp. Finishes dry with a good deal of funk that isnt as evident at the beginning. Nice.


Sampled at the restaurant in Beersel on May 11, 2006.

(Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm. Labeled Jonge Lambiek 6%) Colour is orange-yellow, hazy, foamy head. Nose is acidic, somewhat harsh, with dusty hints of straw. Taste is acidic and harsh remindning of (very) dry white wine. More than medium body. Definitely bitter finish (whether its due to hops or just harshness, I couldnt say). A bit immature and unbalanced, but nicely on its way to greatness.
Draught at Drie Fonteinen. Hazy dark amber colour with no head. Woody acidic aroma. Sour woody flavor.  Long sour aftertaste.

Hazy amber lambic wiht no head. Sweetish actic aroma with notes of pears and light funkyness. Very tart in mouth, almost like orange juice brushign your teeth. Not as intense as other lambic tasted on my trip, but a good lambic. On tap at the Drie Fonteinen restaurant, april 2005.

I have never tasted a beer like this ever!  It was the 14th beer I tasted at the World Beer Festival in Durham, NC.  Really delicious (in small doses) but very sour.  I can definitely understand why lambic beers are usually found blended with some fruit or another.  I was very happy to find such an excellent specimen among so many boring beers though.  I really want to visit the town in Belgium where this stuff is Brewed though!  Wow!  I am beginning to formulate a beer tour of Belgium in my mind.
Amber in colour. Mild fruit and mild funk aroma. Sweet tropic fruits with a funky tart finish. Very tasty stuff.
Ahh lambic.  This is basic, unpretentious and Belgian to the core.  Kind of a watery consistency, but a good mix of flavors, evocative of Cousin Gueuze.
Caramel aroma with hint of acidity. Cloudy brown colour, no head. Fruity, slightly acidic flavour. Caramel aftertaste.
ZBF 2005. Pours a cloudy  dark amber. Aroma is Sour and funky. Taste is sour, acidic, brett, and very nice

Draught, Drie Fonteinen, Beersel, Nov 04.

No head.
Body is hazy light amber.

Aroma is moderately yeasty (horseblanket, barnyard), lightly malty (toasted grain), with notes of wood, lemon, and lime.

Flavor is moderately sweet, heavily acidic.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic.

Medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation.

Yum...nicely aromatic, and beautiful balance.

Hazy orange beer with very little head that dissapears very quickly. Sniffing gives me a sour aroma along with fruits. The taste is somewhat sweet and fruity with flavours of woods, dust and earth. Gives a very dry and acid finish.

Orange coloured beer, no head at all. The first nip gives a very sour aroma. While drinking, it gets sweeter and more fruity. The flavour is somewhat earthy and sour but refreshing. The aftertaste is dry and somewhat acidic.

Thanks to DrNate03 for driving us to Drie Fonteinen! Had this with lunch. Came from a handpump. Clouded brown body with no head. Nose has a light sourness and leathery hint along with wood and tart fruit. Pleasant! Taste is sour with more leather, more sour fruit but not as tart as expected. Minor sweaty notes and rubbery notes as well. Body is mildly acidic and tart with some sparse dryness. Finish is tart but dry with more leather and fruit coming through. Good stuff!

Hand pumped. Dry hoppy canvas aroma, light wheat and sour. Cloudy amber with thin lacing head. Medium body with smooth carbonation. Sour start, high acidity, nice wheat-malt taste. Finish is sour and light chalky. After is pleasant clean dry bitter.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2005 Brewed march 03, straight from the oak cask in a one litre swing top bottle. Brownish orange color, very cloudy, no head. Sedate citrus aroma, lovely honeyish citrus flavor. A fair deal of citric sourness. Cherry and just a hint of oak. A bit milky. Some walnut bitterness. Very complex lambic, especially in the flavor, with a very drinkable and refreshing character. This one is pretty good!!
Re-rate lambic from januari 04, according to Armand De Belder, who filled my litre swing top bottle with this magic stuff. Orange color, just a bit hazy. lemon, mandarin and wood in the nose. Citrus in the flavor, strong woody tones. Just a bit milky. Hint of metal. Honey and mandarin. Just a bit sour. Complex and delicious. (8 3 8 5 17 = 4.1).

This Lambic has great taste and is becoming a world classic. Is imroving every year. What do you expect with a perfectionist brewer who is blending craftmanship & technology in his casks. Go there and taste.

(sampled cask- conditioned (it was a handpump, anyway) at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden) Cloudy golden orange appearance with a rich frothy white head. Strong but smooth and elegant aroma of lemon, wood, soap, stable and grapefruit. Soft but very tasty and complex flavour of lemon and grapefruit. Slightly woody and sour finish but it is slightly overshadowed by the soft, juicy fruity body. Creamy mouthfeel with a flat carbonation. Very nice summerbeer. I will never forget the taste of this glorious brew.
UPDATED: JAN 10, 2005 Cask @ Akkurat, StockholmServed by hand pump as a Real Ale is served. This one is 7% abv. Dangerous stuff. Full bodied. Quite salty! Lime-like aftertaste.

Light hazy orange color. The taste is a wellbalanced sourness with complex sour or bitter patterns. After 2 or 3 pints it gets light fruity but preserves the nice sourness. Thanks Jacob for letting me taste this.

10 liter barrel, courtesy of Jacob Lövenlund: Light dusty orange/amber coloured. Is very beautiful in spite of the missing head. Initially has a very sour an tarty aroma. While drinking, it gets significantly sweeter and fruity. Flavour is earthy and sour but in a very very refreshing and pleasant way. This i really good stuff. Is fresh, dry and acidic in the end with a long lasting on the palate. Thanks again, Jacob.

Sampled from a 10 liter plastic barrel brought  home from Belgium by Jacob Lövenlund - Thanks!!Hazy bright orange beer with no head of course! Aroma is mild sweet and sour with grapefruit and little spices tones. Flavor is sour to begin with but the sourness fades out towards the end. Lots of grapefruit notes. Dry and harsh on the palate. Tasty!
Hazy amber-orange body.  No head.  Horse-blanket aroma.  Moderately acidic initial flavour, lightly bitter finish. Superb lambic.  Armand, we love you!

Sampled from cask at Akkurat, Stockholm (7%).
Cloudy orange with rich head. Concentrated citric aroma. Wonderful soft mouthfeel. Fresh and fruity - lemnon juice! Some grassy hops in the background, a just a hint of barnyard. Superb.

An unclear orange beer with a fine orange head. The aroma is primarily sour but with notes of sweetness as well as lemon and wild fermentation. The flavor is lovely sour with notes of grapefruit, lemon, and oranges. A great Lambic.

Draught, Delerium Café Brussels March 2004. Hazy amber, no head and minimal condition, almost flat but what else would you expect. Typical funky lambic aromas with a fruity citric note and some leatheriness. Fruity tart and quite full bodied in the mouth with some noticable caramel, and a long dry citric finish.
UPDATED: JUN 14, 2004 At Grote Dorst, Eizeringen. No carbonation of course. Notes of grapes and wood. Very fresh. Very complex.
At the brewery - tart, woody, some sweetness, full body. Tangy, very nice drink - mouthwatering.

(1 year, draught) Colour: brown-amber, slightly hazy. No head. Nose: wood, vineous. Taste is rather sweet (brown-candi), background is sourish, lactic, not acetic. Dry-out effect outspoken, even adstringent finish. Long dry, woody aftertaste. Surprisingly sweet for an already 1-year aged lambic.
had this on tap during a visit not the most drinkable compared to some lambics i have a bottle which has been sitting for two years maybe a rerate in the future

Sampled on tap at Drie Fonteinen Virtually headless medium gold crystal clear colour. Old socks and mild musty cellar yeast, citric sour and faint scorched rubber aroma. Medium body with relatively soft but complex palate.  Mild citrus sour start fading quickly to mellow medium bitter/sour middle and moving to a faint fragrant balsamic vinegar flavoured refreshing dry finish. A very good example of this style of beer.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2004 This rating is for the "on tap" version. This you can get at the brewery & restaurant 3fonteinen in Beersel. Goldish coloured with very little head. Aroma:warm rubber wheels and the normal sourness. A sour tingling feeling at the back of the tongue in an otherwise very soft beer. I had this on a very warm summer day.
